question: The marked price of watch was 820 Rs. A man bought the watch for 570.72 Rs. after getting two successive discounts, of which the first was 20%, then the second discount was :
explanation:
Total discount = (820 - 570.72) = 249.28 Rs. 
First discount $latex = 820\\times \\frac{20}{100} = 164\\ Rs.&s=1$
âˆ´ Second discount = (249.28 - 164) = 85.28 Rs.
Price of the article after first discount = (820 - 164) = 656 Rs. 
If the second discount be x%, then x% of 656 = 85.28
$latex => x = \\frac{85.28\\times 100}{656} = 13\\%&s=1$
Hence option [B] is correct answer.
